_header: See and hear and hold still
Note: Same as lines 99-100 of 5530, MS Oxford, Bodleian Library Rawlinson poet. 32 (SC 14526); cf. also 1919, 5235, and 3596.
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Harley 7333, f. 224v; occurs on f. 180 (see 3596)
_description:
A tag in the Fasciculus Morum, and as comment of Third Cock in a story in the Gesta Romanorum; see Whiting (1968)
XWhiting, Bartlett Jere. Proverbs, Sentences, and Proverbial Phrases from English Writings Mainly before 1500. Cambridge, MA: Belknap, 1968, H.264

Bod410.Transcription:
Here & se & holde þe styll if þu wyll lyue and haue
                    þi wyll

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
See and her & held þe stylleȝif þou wolt lyue and
                    haue thi wylle

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Se & here and hold the stylleYf þou wult lyue and haue
                    þy wylle

BodRawC670.Note:
Variant version, 3 lines, which Wenzel (1974)
XWenzel,  Siegfried. 
             “Unrecorded Middle-English Verses.” 
             Anglia
         92 (1974): 55-78 considers as
                    separate.

OxfLinLat52.Transcription:
here and see and hold þe stillIf þou will life and haue
                    þi will

CULIi38.Transcription:
herke & see & hold þe stille& in þis wordl
                    þu hast þy wylle
CULIi38.Note:
Quoted in a Latin sermon on penitence in exemplum based on Gesta
                        Romanorum.
CULIi38.Editions:
Erb,  Peter C. 
             “Vernacular Material for Preaching in MS Camb. Univ. Lib.
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         33 (1971): 63-84: 83.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Here & se & halde þe styll¡if þu wil lyue &
                    haue þi wille

CamGon364.Transcription:
See & here & held þe stylleif þou wylt leue &
                    haue þi wylle

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
here and se & hald þe styllIf þu wyll leyfe and have
                    þi wyll

CamTCC599.Transcription:
Here and se and be styllThow mayst the sonner haue thy
                    wyll
CamTCC599.Note: Not in Fasciculus; occurs at lines 89-90 of 5530.
CamTCC599.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.19.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.19.

BLAdd9066.Transcription:
here and see and hold the stilleand than thou may have all thy
                    wille
BLAdd9066.Editions:
Herbert,  John Alexander. 
             Catalogue of Romances in the Department of MSS. in the British
                Museum.
         Vol. 3. London, 1910: 3.309.
Herrtage,  Sidney John Hervon,
                        ed.  
             The Early English Version of the Gesta Romanorum.
EETS
         e.s. 33 (1879); repr. 1962: 175.

BLHar2270.Transcription: See & here & holde þe stylleþan myȝt þu lyue and haue þy wylle
BLHar2270.Editions:
Madden,  Frederick. 
             The Old English Versions of the Gesta Romanorum.
Roxburghe Club.
         55. London: Nicol, 1838: 147.

BLHar5259.Transcription:
See and here and holde the styllethen miȝthe þu leue &
                    have thy wylle
BLHar5259.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 525.

Herbert,  John Alexander. 
             Catalogue of Romances in the Department of MSS. in the British

EDU82.Transcription:
See and here and holde the styllȝyf thou wolt lyue and haue thy
                    wyll

Lincoln44.Transcription:
See & here And holde þe stylleif þu wille life &
                    haue þi wille

WorcF19.Transcription:
See & here & held þe stylleIf þou wylt leue &
                    haue þi wylle

VaticanOtto.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical

Lam78.Transcription:
See and here and hold the styllethanne myth thow leue in pees and
                    haue thy wille
Lam78.Note:
Written as prose. Wenzel (1974)
XWenzel,  Siegfried. 
             “Unrecorded Middle-English Verses.” 
             Anglia
         92 (1974): 55-78 regards this as couplet 3
                    of 5235.
